title: AT&T Resumes Its Rally After a Brief Pullback
text:
AT&T (T) is surging in early morning trading Monday and it is the 'Stock of the Day' at Real Money. The company reported that they beat Q3 EPS estimates but missed on revenue with a 3% Y/Y drop. The company's strategic review backs a WSJ report earlier this month that activist investor Elliott Management led by Paul Singer was in talks to settle its campaign if AT&T agreed to a review and board changes.

We recommended going long T earlier this month, writing that, "Traders could go long T here or add to existing longs here. Risk to $36 now with $60 as our longer-term price target."

In this daily bar chart of T, below, we can imagine that prices open up around $38.25. Prices tested the rising 50-day simple moving average line last week and are well above the rising 200-day moving average line.

The daily On-Balance-Volume (OBV) line has moved sideways (neutral) since the middle of September matching the price action. A good rally today and strong volume should go far in pushing the OBV line towards a new high.

The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) oscillator has been in a take profits mode since the middle of September, but renewed price strength should turn this indicator to the upside again and a fresh outright go long signal.

In this weekly bar chart of T, below, we can see that prices made an outside weak and lower close. Normally this would be a bearish signal on pretty much any futures chart because of the leverage but on this chart of T we are probably not going to get any follow-through selling. Prices are well above the rising 40-week moving average line.

The weekly OBV line is pointed higher from its low made back in August 2018. The MACD oscillator is in a bullish mode well above the zero line and its recent narrowing is probably not going to result in a downside crossover.

In this weekly close only Point and Figure chart of T, below, we can see that prices have been in a long-term uptrend since 2002-03. The chart shows a longer-term potential upside price target of $60.

Bottom line strategy: T opened higher and with some of the broad market averages making new highs we have an environment that is ripe for additional gains. Stay long T.
